markdown.markdown:
::: {.print-only .contact-block} cdemircan@tutanota.com ::: **PhD -- Institute for Human Centered AI**
*Helmholtz AI, Munich* [*2023 --- *]{.cvdate} - Working on the interpretability of large language models, representation learning, and naturalistic learning - Supervised by Dr. Eric Schulz **MSc -- Neural & Behavioural Sciences**
*University of Tübingen* [*2021 --- 2023*]{.cvdate} - Thesis: Using tools of neuroscience to understand large language models: A case-study of temporal difference learning - Member of the International Max Planck Research School for The Mechanisms of Mental Function and Dysfunction (IMPRS MMFD). **BA -- Experimental Psychology**
*University of Oxford* [*2017 --- 2020*]{.cvdate} - Thesis: How Task Relevance of Stimuli and Expectations Influence Visual Information Processing in the Human Brain - Graduated with 1st Class Honours ::: column-margin ## Skills ***Programming***: Python, R, MATLAB, Bash, HTML, CSS, JavaScript ***Software and Tools***: Git, $\LaTeX$, Markdown, Docker, Singularity, CI/CD ***Languages***: Turkish (native), English (fluent), German (beginner) ::: ## Research Experience **Research Assistant -- Computational Principles of Intelligence**
*Max Planck Institute for Biological Cybernetics* [*2021 --- 2023*]{.cvdate} - Investigating representational basis of how humans learn in naturalistic tasks using online experiments and computational modelling - Supervised by Dr. Eric Schulz **Lab Rotation Student -- Mental Health Mapping**
*Department of Psychiatry, University of Tübingen* [*2022 --- 2023*]{.cvdate} - Investigated how brain structures of Social Anxiety Disorder patients differ from population norms using normative modelling - Supervised by Dr. Thomas Wolfers **Lab Rotation Student -- Vision and Cognition Group**
*Centre for Integrative Neuroscience, Tübingen* [*2022*]{.cvdate} - Investigated how real and implied motion are processed in the human brain using fMRI - Supervised by Prof. Dr. Andreas Bartels & Dr. Pablo Grassi ## Teaching Experience **Software Carpentry -- Version Control with Git**
*University of Twente* [*2022*]{.cvdate} - Taught a one day workshop to PhD students on how to use Git ## Publications & Preprints - **Demircan, C.**, Saanum, T., Pettini, L., Binz, M., Baczkowski, B. M., Kaanders, P., ... Schulz, E. (*2023*). Language Aligned Visual Representations Predict Human Behavior in Naturalistic Learning Tasks. arXiv preprint. [paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.09377), [code](https://candemircan.github.io/NaturalCogSci/), [data](https://osf.io/h3t52/) - **Demircan, C.**, Pettini, L., Saanum, T., Binz, M., Baczkowski, B. M., Doeller, C., ... Schulz, E. (*2022*). Decision-making with naturalistic options. *In Proceedings of the Annual Meeting of the Cognitive Science Society (Vol. 44, No. 44)*. [paper](https://escholarship.org/uc/item/1td8q3wn), [code & data](https://github.com/candemircan/THINGSDecisions) - Şentürk, Y. D., Ünver, N., **Demircan, C.**, Egner, T., & Günseli, E. (2023). The reactivation of task rules triggers the reactivation of task-relevant items. *Cortex*. [preprint](https://osf.io/t7nef), [doi](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cortex.2023.10.024)
